project.description:
- Uses Trends Load to update the Trends database with the results
- Creates JMeter reports for the run.

Trends at DataHunter Trends

You will need to set to update the 'SetPath' parameter for your environment.
See mark59\mark59-trends-load\LoadDataHunterResultsIntoTrends.bat for other database connection examples.
For your setup you may need to do this for the html reports to render properly.

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: parmExecuteScriptVerificationPassed
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description: flag passed through from the Check job

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: parmExecuteResult
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Value indicating status of previous job (Execute)

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: Application
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Application name as it will appear in the Mark59 Trends application

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: Granularity
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Defines the granularity for jmeter graph reporting. Value is in milliseconds

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: JmeterHomeReportGeneration
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Alternate JMeter instance to use for report generations. - allows for customization just for reporting purposes (eg removing the APDEX section)

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: MetricsReportSplit
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description:
Option to create separate report(s) for metric data:
- 'CreateMetricsReport' - create separate file with all non-txn data, suffixed _METRICS,
- 'SplitByDataType' create a file per datatype, suffixed with _{datatype}.
- 'No' - just put everything in the one output file (this is the program default when if paremeter is not entered)

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: ErrorTransactionNaming
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description:
How to handle txns marked as failed.
- 'Rename' suffixes the failed txn names with '_ERRORED'.
- 'Duplicate' keeps the orignal txn plus adds a '_ERRORED' txn.
- 'No' - just keep original txn name. (this is the program default when if paremeter is not entered)

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: eXcludeResultsWithSub
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description:
Whether to exclude the 'main' sample Result data for sample Results that have SubResults.
- 'True' exclude main Results (this is the program default when if paremeter is not entered).
- 'False' include main Results.

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: cdpfilter
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description:
'ShowCDP' (the default) will include CDP transaction in the transactions. 'HideCDP' will remove any CDP transactions from the report. 'OnlyCDP' will create a transactions report that ONLY contains transactions marked as CDP transactions.
Metrics report(s) will not be affected, as CDP filtering only applies transactional data

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: eXcludestart
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description:
(optional) EXclude results at the start of the test for the given number of minutes. Filter eg: -x 10
Leave blank for no exculsion.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: captureperiod
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description:
(optional) EXclude results at the start of the test for the given number of minutes. Filter eg: -c 60
Leave blank for no exculsion.

hudson.tasks.BatchFile.command: C: echo parmExecuteScriptVerificationPassed=%parmExecuteScriptVerificationPassed% echo parmExecuteResult=%parmExecuteResult% set PATH=%SetPath% echo PATH is %PATH% java -version if "%parmExecuteResult%" equ "Execution_OK" ( echo "load results into graphical comparative analysis tooling" cd C:\mark59\mark59-trends-load\target java -jar mark59-trends-load.jar -a %Application% -i C:\Mark59_Runs\Jmeter_Results\%Application% -d h2 %eXcludestart% %captureperiod% -r "run %BUILD_NUMBER%" echo "convert xml file to csv" if exist C:\Mark59_Runs\Jmeter_Results\%Application%\MERGED\ RD /S /Q C:\Mark59_Runs\Jmeter_Results\%Application%\MERGED mkdir C:\Mark59_Runs\Jmeter_Results\%Application%\MERGED\ cd C:\mark59\mark59-results-splitter\target java -jar mark59-results-splitter.jar -iC:\Mark59_Runs\Jmeter_Results\%Application% -f%Application%TestResults_converted.csv -m%MetricsReportSplit% -e%ErrorTransactionNaming% -x%eXcludeResultsWithSub% -c%cdpfilter% echo "run jmeter report(s) generation" rmdir /s /q C:\Mark59_Runs\JenkinsJmeterReports\%Application% md C:\Mark59_Runs\JenkinsJmeterReports\%Application% rmdir /s /q C:\Mark59_Runs\JenkinsJmeterReports\%Application%_CPU_UTIL md C:\Mark59_Runs\JenkinsJmeterReports\%Application%_CPU_UTIL rmdir /s /q C:\Mark59_Runs\JenkinsJmeterReports\%Application%_DATAPOINT md C:\Mark59_Runs\JenkinsJmeterReports\%Application%_DATAPOINT rmdir /s /q C:\Mark59_Runs\JenkinsJmeterReports\%Application%_MEMORY md C:\Mark59_Runs\JenkinsJmeterReports\%Application%_MEMORY rmdir /s /q C:\Mark59_Runs\JenkinsJmeterReports\%Application%_METRICS md C:\Mark59_Runs\JenkinsJmeterReports\%Application%_METRICS cd %JmeterHomeReportGeneration%\bin jmeter -Dlog4j2.formatMsgNoLookups=true -Jjmeter.reportgenerator.overall_granularity=%Granularity% -g C:\Mark59_Runs\Jmeter_Results\%Application%\MERGED\%Application%TestResults_converted.csv -o C:\Mark59_Runs\JenkinsJmeterReports\%Application% jmeter -Dlog4j2.formatMsgNoLookups=true -Jjmeter.reportgenerator.overall_granularity=%Granularity% -g C:\Mark59_Runs\Jmeter_Results\%Application%\MERGED\%Application%TestResults_converted_CPU_UTIL.csv -o C:\Mark59_Runs\JenkinsJmeterReports\%Application%_CPU_UTIL jmeter -Dlog4j2.formatMsgNoLookups=true -Jjmeter.reportgenerator.overall_granularity=%Granularity% -g C:\Mark59_Runs\Jmeter_Results\%Application%\MERGED\%Application%TestResults_converted_DATAPOINT.csv -o C:\Mark59_Runs\JenkinsJmeterReports\%Application%_DATAPOINT jmeter -Dlog4j2.formatMsgNoLookups=true -Jjmeter.reportgenerator.overall_granularity=%Granularity% -g C:\Mark59_Runs\JenkinsJmeterReports\%Application%\MERGED\%Application%TestResults_converted_MEMORY.csv -o C:\Mark59_Runs\JenkinsJmeterReports\%Application%_MEMORY jmeter -Dlog4j2.formatMsgNoLookups=true -Jjmeter.reportgenerator.overall_granularity=%Granularity% -g C:\Mark59_Runs\Jmeter_Results\%Application%\MERGED\%Application%TestResults_converted_METRICS.csv -o C:\Mark59_Runs\JenkinsJmeterReports\%Application%_METRICS TIME /T ) SET mailmessage=nothing if "%parmExecuteResult%" equ "Execution_OK" ( SET mailmessage=Scenario_Run_ok ) if "%parmExecuteResult%" equ "Execution_failure" ( SET mailmessage=Scenario_Run_Fail ) if %parmExecuteScriptVerificationPassed% equ false ( SET mailmessage=Script_verify_failure ) echo BEGINMAIL%mailmessage%ENDMAIL if "%parmExecuteResult%" equ "Execution_OK" ( exit 0 ) if "%parmExecuteResult%" equ "Execution_failure" ( exit 1 ) if %parmExecuteScriptVerificationPassed% equ false ( exit 1 )
